enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-requisite: Students must have completed CHEM103 or CHEM 172 to register for this course

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: (.34 units) Experiments and independent projects to elucidate the functioning of organisms at cellular, tissue, and organ system levels.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: MATH 220; CHEM 102 or 172; Bio 220 and 221

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Bio 222 will consist of one project, a transgenic Drosophila model of Parkinson's Disease. throughout the term emphasis will be placed on the steps of the scientific process: Formulating hypotheses, designing and executing experiments, analyzing data (including statistical analyses), and presenting results in written and oral formats. Student will work in groups of 3 or 4 for the project.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Group work: One oral presentation,research proposal, and a peer critique of another lab group's research proposal. Individual assessment: Three quizzes.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: All required handouts and online lectures by the instructor will be placed on the course's Canvas web site.
